title: Wi-Fi SW Test Engineer
summary: The people here at Apple don’t just build products — they craft the kind of wonder that revolutionises entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it. You will work on development of automation for testing new and proprietary wireless protocols. You will join a dynamic team responsible for qualifying the latest company products, having a direct influence on the product quality and user experience all over the world.
description: You will join a dynamic quality assurance engineering team, responsible for functional and performance validation of Wi-Fi (and other wireless technologies) features on Apple products. In this role you will be responsible for design and development of automation for testing embedded firmware and entire systems. You will be required to lead investigations and analyze failures or performance behavior. It is required to master the skills of problem solving, creativity and programming along with achieving detailed understanding of embedded systems and our wireless protocols.
key_qualifications:
3+ years of relevant experience
Experience in system or firmware testing
Excellent programming skills (Python or any other scripting language, OOP)
Experience with data communication or wireless protocols
Experience with Linux, macOS or Unix based
Low and/or high level understanding of wireless protocols (Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, etc.) - an advantage
Experience with testing equipment
Experience in automation development- an advantage
education_experience: Bachelors in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or Equivalent
additional_requirements:
Laser-focused on the smallest details that are meaningful to our customers.
Passion for actively learning new skills, techniques, and programming languages/libraries/frameworks.
Comfortable in working with multi-functional teams to drive efficient bug resolution
